title: Model-Guidance: Removing Classifier-Free Guidance for Improved Diffusion Models
author: Zhicong Tang (Tsinghua University), Jianmin Bao (Microsoft Research Asia), Dong Chen (Microsoft Research Asia), Baining Guo (Microsoft Research Asia), ... , Haohe Liu (University of Surrey)
relevance_why: The proposed Model-guidance method could inspire similar approaches in audio processing tasks, particularly in manipulating latent representations or improving efficiency in generative models used for audio and speech applications.
background: This paper addresses the performance limitations of diffusion models, specifically the effectively of Classifier-free guidance by introducing a new objective that incorporates posterior probability for better training efficiency and sample quality.
contribution: This paper introduces Model-guidance (MG) to solve the drawbacks of Classifier-free guidance in diffusion models, achieving significant improvements in training speed and sample quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like Classifier-free guidance compromise efficiency by requiring multiple forward passes and concurrent training of conditional and unconditional models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by eliminating the need for multiple evaluations and achieving comparable or better quality with a sole forward pass.

key_innovation: Reconceptualizes the training of diffusion models by utilizing them as implicit classifiers and directly estimating scores for generation.
real_world_impact: The proposed method has the potential to enhance the generation quality and speed of models used in various applications, including those in image, audio, and video generation, facilitating quicker deployment of generative technologies.
limitations: The dependency on a hyper-parameter, guidance scale, may require careful tuning for optimal performance.

new_terms.Model-guidance: **Model-guidance** is a newly introduced method aimed at improving the training and performance of diffusion models by replacing the traditional Classifier-free guidance framework.
new_terms.posterior probability: **Posterior probability** is the probability of an event occurring after obtaining additional evidence, often used in Bayesian statistics to update the probability estimate of a hypothesis as more evidence becomes available.
